channel.description: We're not just bringing you a podcast, we're delivering a vlogcast with world class entrepreneurs straight to your ear drums & eyeballs to help you get insight into the world that is start ups, home businesses, entrepreneurship, companies & corporations. No sugar coating and highlight reels here... just authentic heart, stories, info & advice. Head over to our website www.babestalkingbusiness.com to watch our vlogcast and follow us on instagram at @babestalkingbusiness to keep posted with our adventures, sneak peaks of future episodes along with daily inspo, bizz hacks, tips and tricks for you fellow entrepreneurs out there! So excited to have you here and can not wait to connect with you! Love Lozz and Chan xx

item.title: Episode 41: Protecting your health as a Business Owner with Andy and Katie Mant
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
This has got to be one of our favourite episodes, now it’s not a traditional episode of ours where we talk about their business journey and the evolution of Blublox , although we need to get these back on to talk about that because they have created something pretty awesome! But this episode is all about you and your health as a business owner in particular if you spend a lot of time in front of your computer working and exposing your body to high levels of toxic blue light, like us, we work 100% online and sometimes you’ll see us pulling 16+ hour days, all in front of the computer. So this episode was AMAZZZZING because they explain to us the difference between good and bad light. It’s so educational, the guys do a really good job of helping us understand the sources of blue light that we’re exposed to every day and what we can do about it, and how blue light is compromising our health, sleep, energy, hormones and more. And how to mitigate the damage by blue light and the hacks we can implant into our life today.

Now you might not be business owner, maybe you’re one of the many people at home right now in isolation with whats going on in the world right now and if that's you, we can bet our bottom dollar you are at home on your phone and in front of the tv more than you have ever been before. If you’re either of these two - this episode is for you.

What do you do when so many modern-day health issues point to artificial blue light as a cause yet so many products designed to address it are cheaply made, not backed by science and, well let’s face it – ugly, that very few people are embracing light management?
Well, you create a company that flips all that on its head.

And that’s exactly what Andy & Katie have done with BLUblox - they’ve created a world-leading advanced light-filtering eyewear that is medically backed by science …. which after talking with these 2, I am soooooo excited for my very own pair to come in the mail, I've just checked my tracking number and I should have them in my hands in just a couple of days I cannot wait. Now if you’d love to get yourself a pair, and trust me you’re going to want a pair of blue blox over any other and this episode will help you understand why, make sure you head over to the blue box website and you can us our very own discount code "BTB" on check out You can find all their details such as their website, Instagram & discount code all in the show notes below.

website: www.blublox.com
instagram: instagram.com/blubloxofficial
Facebook: facebook.com/blublox

item.title: Episode 40: Eliza Landgren, Founder of Elle Fit Active
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
After learning how to manage pain from scoliosis and navigating her way through chronic fatigue, anxiety and depression, Elle brings light to tough times with her authenticity and humour. Since launching Elle Fit Active in 2014, her stretching guide Get Bendy is helping people in over 100 countries.

In this episode we dive deep into the story behind Elle starting her business and what that's looked like behind the scenes, we know for a fact this will inspire so many of you who are in your start up phase if business, whether you're packing items yourself, hiring your first staff member, leasing a space or making mistakes that are equipping you to be a better business owner.

This episode will totally hit home for you as Elle shares how she too, has been there before.

item.title: Episode 38: Katie and Liv, Co-founders of Inner Glow Circle
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
This week we got to chat to the Co-Founders of Inner Glow Circle -Katie DePaola and Liv Chapman. A company that helps women who want to work for themselves, not by themselves as an entrepreneur. Inner Glow Circle trains clients to become an accredited life coach through the International Coach Federation (ICF) and helps them to create a sustainable business they’ll love through group training programs and masterminds. Katie and her team at Inner Glow Circle have been featured in ICF, Time, HuffPost, Elite Daily, Hay House, Entreprenista, and on podcasts including Raising the Bar, Life Unfiltered with Alexa, Light Hustle, Curiously You | Who You Are Matters, and Struggle to Success to name a few.

In our episode we got to delve deep and talk about:

- Reality of women building businesses that work around their family and health

- How more women are looking for contribution, collaboration and partnerships in Business

- Starting before you’re ready

- Trusting your intuition and following the breadcrumbs, having the vision and doing the hard things step by step, building empires brick by brick

- Pivoting as you listen to what your business needs and transitioning from working in your business to on your business

- The Perks of business - is it really worth it?


Website: https://innerglowcircle.com/

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/innerglowcircle/

item.title: Episode 37: Michael Huxley - Founder of Huxley School of Makeup
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Michael is a multi award winning creative with over 10 years experience working on major projects and productions throughout Australia and overseas. Within the the last 12months alone, Michael has lead teams in BoraBora, Hawaii, and Japan working on campaigns for companies including Village Road Show Movie Makers, L’Oreal x Balmain cosmetics, TerryWhite, Saski, Eye Of Horus, Lorna Jane, Kryolan, Moana Bikini, and many more. Michael was also the makeup director for the official 2018 Commonwealth Games, running the department which created hair and makeup looks for over 7000 people, including athletes, pro cast, mass cast and headline talent. Michael is also the founder of the prestigious Huxley School of Makeup which is both industry and government endorsed as a preferred territory education provider and the Number 1 industry ranked makeup school in Australia and Asia Pacific with graduates working in all aspects of this creative industry including; film, fashion, bridal and cosmetics industries.   

In this awesome episode with Michael we chat about:

- His evolution from free lancing to building his empire that is today

- What his mission and legacy is

- How he has overcome adversity an in industry which can be extremely competitive and brutal

- And the journey of how he built an educational institute out of something that was once a hobby for him plus so much more

Find Michael at:

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/huxleyschoolofmakeup/

item.title: EPISODE 36: Stacey Hollands, founder of Lust Mineral Cosmetics
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
This episode we have Stacey Hollands owner of Lust Minerals a natural beauty product company which launched in 2014 and has now grown to have 6 employees and over 220k+ ig followers, and this last financial having a staggering 438% GROWTH on the previous year. All while having a toddler, pregnancy/birth and newborn!

After many years of researching the effects of chemicals, fillers, parabens and dyes in everyday products that we all apply to our skin daily, it became apparent that a lot of us just aren’t aware of the side effects and 4-5 years ago purchasing chemical free skin care or makeup cost the earth and not many people could justify their money on these sorts of products. Their original strategy was to only sell through stockists as they had the customer base but they slowly realised that most retailers didn't have the same drive as us to promote the product, it was just another thing on their shelf.

So in this episode we got talk about:

- how Stacey took her business into her own hands

- capitalising and growing their social media platforms

- selling directly to the public via their website

- utilising social media to grow their brand awareness

Website & Socials;

Recent magazine article https://www.lustminerals.com.au/lust-for-life/

item.title: Episode 35: Our Cohost Lauren King is officially a PUBLISHED author!
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
GET YOUR HANDS ON THE BOOK PRESALE: http://bit.ly/BuyTheBookLifeAboveZero


Our very own BTB cohost Lauren King is officially a PUBLISHED AUTHOR! She also a Life and Mindset Coach, Blogger, Speaker and Mentor for thousands of women around the world who want to create a ‘Life Above Zero’.   Lauren holds a Bachelor of Psychology with Honours and is an International accredited Neurolinguistic Practitioner. Lauren started in Child Protection helping families make meaningful change and address Child protection concerns so families could be kept together or reunified after Child protection Orders had been taken. She soon realised she wanted to empower families, especially women with the education, awareness and support to create a life they loved filled with health, wealth and abundance earlier in life so they never found themselves is situations where they were misusing substances to numb emotional pain, settling for jobs or lifestyles that didn’t honour their values, or staying in domestic violent relationships because they didn’t have money of their own or the self belief and self worth to leave. Lauren pivoted and started her own Practise inspiring women to live a "Life Above Zero" a term coined in the positive psychology field that reminds people that happiness and health are more than the absence of unhappiness and disease.

In the Western world, we now have a higher standard of living than humans have ever known before and yet, humans today don’t seem very happy. We are experiencing a mental health epidemic - the World Health Organisation estimates that depression is currently the fourth biggest, costliest, and most debilitating disease in the world and by the year 2020, it will be the second biggest, so it inspired Lauren to create a space for some REAL TALK, with her book 'Life Above Zero - Making Mindset Manageable, Health holistic, Spirituality Science and Life Liberating'.

Lauren’s book book equips you with the practical skills and mindset, backed with the psychology, research, and statistics to help you unlock the code to success, in your life, relationships and career (with some positive, warm and fuzzy vibes thrown in, sprinkled with tough love). This book is special because not only does it share personable stories that we can all relate to (reminding you that you are not alone in what you're going through), but it also has the credentials and research behind it giving it the credibility and applicability in the wellness, health and business space.

In this episode we talk about;

- What inspired Lauren to write a book

- What the book is about

- Who will best benefit from the book and what you will gain from reading it

- The process of writing and publishing a book in case it's something on your bucket list too!

Lauren's website: http://www.lifeabovezero.com.au

Lauren's instagram: https://www.instagram.com/life_above_zero/

Laurens Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_dv9lDB0rQAwcFSLut5ucw

item.title: Episode 34: Brooke Vulinovich
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Brooke Vulinovich is an Instagram specialist, international keynote speaker, founder of Villa Management and creator of the global Social Club Membership and Academy. Brooke teaches businesses worldwide how to leverage the power of Social Media and how fun and easy it can be to connect with their customers online. With a background in sales and marketing, Brooke’s love of customer service and her enthusiastic personality allowed her to quickly skyrocket through the digital marketing world to become one of Australia’s most influential Instagram speakers and trainers. Working with brands like Dermalogica, Mazda and City of Perth, Brooke’s training can show you how to grow your online presence and use it as an effective business medium. In this episode we chat to this funny and upbeat mega babe about her journey in business and what she's overcome on her way to the top. She shares some hilarious happenings that will have you feeling like you're not alone building your business and winging it along the way and she also shares the evolution of herself as a business woman who was unsure in what she wanted to do, dabbling in studies and not finishing them, to now being super clear on her mission and message. www.villamanagement.com.au

Instagram: @brookevulinovich / @villamanagement

Facebook: @brookevulinovich @villamanagementco

item.title: Episode 33: Kashlee Kucheran
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Kashlee Kucheran is a full time travel blogger, author and minimalist who is an advocate of collecting experiences instead of things. She made the bold decision to sell her house and 90% of her belongings so that she could explore the globe while building up her travel brand. Her popular blog, Travel Off Path gets over 1 million visitors per year and offers readers the latest travel news and advice.

Learning from the pressure in her own past, she loves to talk about mental wellness with social media and how to escape the ‘comparison game’ trap online. We dive into topics like: - her transition from being a successful real estate agent to minimalist blogger who travels the world

- How she has monetised her blog and her tips and tricks on how you can too

- Her personal hardship and lessons around having it all, and how that didn’t bring her real happiness

- And her social media tips on how to be present and in the moment, whilst still influencing and inspiring your audience online - without compromise.

Website: https://www.traveloffpath.com

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kashlee_k/

Book: http://amzn.to/2CASrbT

item.title: Episode 32: Ashy Bines
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Todays episode we have the gorgeous Ashy Bines Co-Founder and Creative Director of the Ashy Bines Group. Ashy is seriously a woman on a mission! Many of you know her as one of Australia’s leading Entrepreneurs in the wellness space, she’s a Personal trainer, a speaker, wife, mother and design powerhouse with her pioneering Squad App has revolutionised health, fitness and wellbeing for women across the globe.

Ashy’s core motivation is to encourage, support and empower women with the resources and knowledge to live their best life.

Many of us follow and see Ashy the inspirational mumma and girl next door online but in this episode we see Ashy with her business hat on and man does she deliver giving us insight into her world

We dive into topics like

- What its been like for her behind the scenes building the empire she has

- Her incredible mindset for the days where it just seems to be way too tough

- She shares her journey from being a PT with a small group fitness class on the Gold Coast to having group fitness groups all around Australia, opening her gym, her cafe and now going online and launching her app.

item.title: Episode 31: Kali Gray
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Kali Gray is a Body Confidence Expert, registered Dietitian, speaker, corporate wellness consultant, 'non-diet' coach and author.

Having struggled with disordered eating in her teens, Kali is passionate about helping women and teams be healthy free from dieting and feel confident in their body image. When she's not running her business, My Food Culture, which reaches clients internationally and from all walks of life, Kali can be found in her home on the beautiful Sunshine Coast of Australia.


This week we got to dive into topics like;

- What it can really be like transitioning into the coaching space

- Working out how much you charge

- Kali shares her personal face down moments and her mindset that helped her overcome those times

- Some pretty real truths of owning a business, that most people don't consider before entering entrepreneurship

item.title: Episode 30: Libby Crow
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Libby Crow is a global mentor for entrepreneurs helping them grow their businesses and their minds. She is the founder of LC International, a marketing strategy company for digital consultants, and Co-Founder of The Daily Shift, a personal development company for aspiring and accomplished entrepreneurs alike. She’s dedicated to helping entrepreneurs see the journey as a bridge to raising the vibration of the planet and then later as a portal for giving back philanthropically.

This week we got to have a soul to soul chat with Libby about over coming the fear that comes up in business, our own money stories, learning how to outsource and delegate in order to upscale and have a bigger impact and profit! We also got to get real and vulnerable about women experiencing burn out in business and the art of balancing masculine and feminine energy when running a business. Libby shares her own personal experiences of learning how to rest and make self care a priority whilst also being a successful Entrepreneur so you can sustain energy and be of service to the world - balancing both ‘doing’ and ‘being’.

item.title: Episode 28: Anna Richards
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Welcome to episode 28 of the BTB podcast. Todays episode will have you fired up and excited to chase your dreams with total boss babe Anna Richards on the show sharing her golden nuggets and knowledge bombs. Anna is a network marketing professional, who has been in the industry for 6 years. Prior to NWM, she had spent 4 years in Federal Politics, working for a Federal Member of Parliament.

She was always looking for ‘another way’ however and at age 25 she quit her career after she had found another way - network marketing. Within her first 3 months of saying Yes to her company, she ranked advanced herself to the top leadership level. At the 6 month mark, she rank advanced herself to a 6 figure a year residual income, and by the 12 month mark was earning a multiple six figure a year income (which she has earned ever since) and at month 16 she was also able to bring her husband Morgan home from his full time career. Fast forward 5 years, and she has cumulatively earnt over $1 Million U.S, which she has built predominantly through social media, has been awarded almost every award her company can offer, has spoken on stages all around the world and has grown a team to over 20,000 strong.

Today we chat about so much, in particular redefining the industry and raising its standards. Even though Anna is in a totally different company to us, we want to show you that its always been about collaboration over competition and that we are so insanely passionate about impacting as many lives as possible with our industry, knowing this is the most genius business model on the planet.

We dive into topics like
- How you can create unbelievable financial security in your life with this business model, doing something you already innately do every single day, and doing it authentically.
- What to do when your parter doesn’t support you
- Creating hobby income or business income , and deciding what you want from this profession and the mindset needed to own that space
- Annas secret to how she’s crushed her busienss & built wealth fast and broke all her company records and + so much more

item.title: Episode 25: Sophie Ballantyne Babes in Business National Marketing Director
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
On this episode we have our beautiful friend Sophie Ballantyne who we have the pleasure of working with apart of Babes In Business. Sophie is a Registered Nurse turned certified holistic health coach who fell in love with preventative and holistic health, with manifestation, and wanting to create a life she loved to live, all whilst making an impact in alignment with her values. Soph joined the BIB team 2 years ago and in that time has not only created an incredibly thriving and soul centred business where she helps thousands of women every day, but she’s also recently reached the pinnacle position of our company and is one of our National Marketing Directors who’s built an incredible team both in Australia and internationally. Feeling uninspired, unfulfilled and exhausted working as a Nurse, Sophie joined Babes in Business in January 2017 with the hopes of working for herself, but not by herself, with the beautiful Babes in Biz tribe of uplifting and supporting women alongside her.

Over this past 2.5 years with ups, downs, challenges and everything in between - Sophie has been able to leave her nursing job, start travelling the world, and working towards the dream of becoming a full time mermaid. She is fiercely passionate about not only empowering women to take charge of their health on a holistic level, but also help them realise that they can be, do, and have anything they desire and to not settle for anything less. In Sophs episode we talk about so many incredible golden nuggets such as the hardship along her journey to success and what it actually looks like getting to the top, she gives us incredible advice on how to manage situations you cant control, we talk about gracious leadership and what that looks like, embracing the duality - the ring and yang - in business, and we ask her if the hardship is really worth it.

Ambitious in her pursuits to teach women how to live a healthy lifestyle, Georgie preaches her "health without obsession" message wherever she goes, and this message filters down into all aspects of her personal brand and thriving business. item.title: Episode 23: Frazer Brooks
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Frazer Brookes is a second generation Network Marketing professional who was one of the first to use Facebook to build his business to over 300,000 customers in less than 5 years! After attending his first event in 1987 in the womb of his mother, he went on to see his parents earn 8 figures from the industry. In 2010 he decided to follow in their footsteps & begin his incredibly successful career! Today he is a generic coach and speaker in the industry and recently attracted the attention of Eric Worre, being one of the key note speakers of the 2018 famous annual industry event, Go Pro & one of the first generic trainers to speak on the GoPro stage What Frazer has been able to achieve since 2017 from starting up in the coaching space is phenomenal: He now also Runs Europes #1 Community for Network Marketers The Ninja NetworkerHe’s Started The Success Summit, the biggest generic event in EuropeIn the last 2 years his trainings have been viewed by over 250,000 network marketers from all over the world and now its our time to have him with us...

He’s Spoken on stage in 20 different countries and has helped hundreds of thousands of Networkers around the world to start, promote and grow their businesses online. Today we chat about all things business, building on social media in particular his secret to visibility online, he talks about his personal story of starting up in the industry and transitioning into the coaching space, we also touch on money mindset and his biggest lesson around earning and spending, in particular he shares he’s rules around saving your income from this business and his personal lessons he’s learnt along the way with this.

item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
This weeks episode is a little bit different and to be honest one we thought we would never need to do but the intention of this podcast was to bring you guys truth and realness of behind the scenes of business so this episode comes from a place of wanting to empower and educate you guys, to make the right decisions within your business, in particular for those of you who are in the network marketing profession, so you can learn from what we’re currently experiencing and growing through. We talk about what it takes to be successful and why chasing shiny objects and the next best thing isn’t going to serve you or your goals of success, we talk about what it means to have grit, the on flow effects of delayed gratification and why that will serve you ten fold compared to giving up when it gets hard, we talk about researching longevity and sustainability in your business, abundant vs scarcity mindset, bad behaviour online from network marketers and how that sadly tarnishes the reputation of this profession, and why getting caught up in hype will do the exact opposite of attracting abundance to you.

item.title: Episode 11: Skye Hoyle
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
This episode we chat with Skye, the founder of Australian company The Tea Whisperer which was born out of appreciation for courage, compassion and connection. Skye talks about how she was be born into a family that was heavily impacted by mental health which taught her that if she could personally do one thing every day to lighten just one person's day when someone is experiencing one of their darkest moments then she had no choice but to do this business that is so beautifully revolved around raising awareness of mental health and giving back.

What started off as a small little side hustle and hobby to now one of the most recognised tea’s on social media, you’re going to love hearing how Skye built this awesome business from the ground up around a full time job and around her personal life story.

item.title: EPISODE 6 - FADY HANNA
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Hear from Fady, director of Flagship Digital, a digital marketing company who is creating huge waves in the branding game. Fady has been featured on TedTalks, Forbes, BRW and more and has snatched up The Young Entrepreneur of The Year Award twice. Flagship works on branding and marketing campaigns for companies from startups through to multi national organizations including Virgin, Citibank, BMW, Groupon, Telstra and The Iconic to name a few. In this episode Fady shares how he has built Flagship from the ground up - being recognized as one of Australia’s fastest growing companies for the last 3 years in a row. As well as sharing some of his own tips and tricks on how he trains his mind to look for opportunities and think like an entrepreneur.
Website: www.https://flagship.agency/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/flagshipdigital/

item.title: EPISODE 5 - RACHEL PEDRETTI
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
We are so excited for you to hear from the beautiful Rachel Pedretti this week! Rach had a fulfilling career, working as an Intensive Care Nurse for 10 years, she worked her way to the top of her profession and loved what she did, but her lifestyle and health suffered. She stumbled across a product on her health and wellness journey that she fell in love with and was sharing with her loved ones as people started to notice and ask her what she was doing differently. Rach soon started to realise there were more people out there just like her, dealing with the same issues.
Before she knew it, her new passion started to pay her as she learnt the power behind network marketing. Tune in to hear how a new life purpose and an entrepreneurial dream has transpired to creating a 7 figure income in less than 4 years. Rach is honest and transparent about her journey in hope she can shed some light and offer some advice to anyone who finds themselves working in a similar situation and wanting better health and a better lifestyle.

item.title: EPISODE 4 - CASEY LYONS
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Meet Casey Lyons, a 29 year old former carpenter turned co-founder of Nationally recognised non for profit Charity, LIVIN. LIVIN was founded in honour of Casey's best friend, Dwayne Lally who sadly took his life after living in silence with a mental illness. LIVIN is all about living your life at the top and breaking the stigma of mental health. Connecting, supporting and encouraging one another to talk about their feelings and challenges because “It Ain’t Weak to Speak”. Learn the ins and outs and behind the scenes of running a non-for profit charity with this episode and what it takes to get such a powerful mission off the ground running.
website: www.livin.org facebook: www.facebook.com/livinorg instagram: www.instagram.com/livinorg twitter: www.twitter.com/livinorg

item.title: EPISODE 3 - KARINA IRBY
item.dc:creator: Babes In Business
item.description:
Tune in to meet Karina Irby! Not only a real life mermaid but the Owner and Designer of the International Swimwear line Moana Bikini! What started off as an innocent love affair with cheekier-cut bikini’s in 2012, has transpired into a million dollar business, an army of raving Moana babes, and a brand where women around the world are empowered to feel beautiful in their own skin (eczema, cellulite and all) as well as being educated about health with Karina releasing her own work out “BIKINI BODY BURN” and nutrition guide “EAT”. This self taught powerhouse gets real and raw on how she built her business from scratch without borrowing any money from the banks, the behind the scenes of her business startup, a day in the life of, how she deals with negativity and also her thoughts on cellulite and photo editing. She's hilarious, she's a leader in her industry and you are going to love getting to know her better.
website: https://moanabikini.com instagram: Instagram.com/moana_bikini facebook: facebook.com/moanabikini
